labLeader.name: Dr. Daria Anderson
labLeader.title: Lab Director & Principal Investigator
labLeader.description: Dr. Anderson is currently running her lab at The University of Sydney, where she explores structural and functional decoupling in a mouse model of temporal lobe epilepsy as a biomarker for network restructuring. Previously, she was a Post Doctoral Researcher and Doctorate Student / Research Assistant at The University of Utah, specializing in neuromodulation, epilepsy research, and electrophysiology.
education: Ph.D. in Neuroscience from The University of Utah
Post Doctoral Researcher at The University of Utah
Current: Lab Director at The University of Sydney
achievements: Leading research on temporal lobe epilepsy biomarkers
Expert in structural and functional network analysis

researchAreas.title: Temporal Lobe Epilepsy
researchAreas.description: Investigating structural and functional decoupling in mouse models of temporal lobe epilepsy as biomarkers for network restructuring and therapeutic development.

researchAreas.title: Network Restructuring
researchAreas.description: Studying how neural networks reorganize during epilepsy and developing biomarkers to track structural and functional changes in the brain.

researchAreas.title: Electrophysiology
researchAreas.description: Advanced electrophysiological techniques to understand neural activity patterns and electrical properties in epilepsy models and network analysis.
